result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew N Beutin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence Credit for 1 day granted if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 2.

miscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meeting per week and obtain a sponsor.

No violent contact with victim.   Valid prescriptions to be taken only in the manner they were prescribed.  Follow through with Mental Health treatment/counseling.
DNA Sample waived.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Court costs waived.  Cash bail to be refunded to poster.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Concurrent with: Count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew N Beutin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Terminated
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Andrew N Beutin in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:

Count 1:
- 90 days Huber with standard release conditions CONCURRENT with Count 2. STAYED.  Credit for 1 day if revoked.
- 1 year Probation. 
- Court costs waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.  No violent contact with victim.  Follow through with Mental Health treatment/counseling.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week and obtain a sponsor.

Count 2:
- 90 days Huber with standard release conditions CONCURRENT with Count 1. STAYED.  Credit for 1 day if revoked.
- 1 year Probation. 
- Court costs waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Same as Count 1.

Defendant Andrew N Beutin in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses motion filed in 14CM2047.  This matter to follow along for further scheduling.  Hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Andrew N Beutin in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant updates address.  This matter to follow along with 14CM2047 for further scheduling.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Andrew N Beutin in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense does not have an offer. State does not have discovery on the new file - 15CM487. Court will give another date in 30 days.  Hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Andrew N Beutin
Current: 5482 Morehead Lane, Greendale, WI 53129 United States  (Effective: 04-03-2015)
Prior: N93 W25866 Riverview Drive, Colgate, WI 53017

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Andrew N Beutin in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
